bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 4 (Wednesday, January 9, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. BROWNLEY of California:H.R. 372.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8[Page H359]

item.name: Crime and Federal Government Surveillance Subcommittee
Crime and Federal Government Surveillance Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

item.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

summary.text:
Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act

This bill extends public safety officers' death benefits to Transportation Security Administration employees performing official duties related to protecting the nation's transportation systems.

bill.title: Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act

item.title: Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act

To amend the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to provide for the eligibility of Transportation Security Administration employees to receive public safety officers' death benefits, and for other purposes.
Honoring Our Fallen TSA Officers Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
